RevisedPrescription: The patient is prescribed Amoxicillin to treat a diagnosed bacterial infection. Usage: Take 500 mg orally three times a day for 7 to 10 days. Amoxicillin is a broad-spectrum antibiotic effective against various bacteria commonly involved in respiratory tract infections.
Acetaminophen is recommended for pain relief. Usage: Take 500 mg orally every 4 to 6 hours as needed.
Omeprazole is prescribed to prevent gastrointestinal complications associated with Amoxicillin use. Usage: Take 20 mg orally once daily before breakfast.
